intro: Tithymalus craspedius, commonly known as the hairy tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Tithymalus craspedius is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
